Tue, Apr 03, 2018 at 08:27pm

🎵 I re-listened to The Decemberists’ I’ll Be Your Girl today, and was surprised that all the songs sounded like I had always known them. I enjoyed the album a lot more today than on my first listen.

Tue, Apr 03, 2018 at 04:42pm

Did you know you can filter Excel spreadsheet columns by color? You sure can! It came in handy today.

Tue, Apr 03, 2018 at 03:00pm

Someone just tried to hack into my Apple account. Scary! I’m glad I have two factor authentication turned on. I got notifications on all my devices and quickly changed my password for the first time in a couple years. I wonder what happened.

Sun, Apr 01, 2018 at 09:23pm

Our plans today include Easter egg dying and a Passover Seder with family. I prefer brisket to Easter ham any day.

Sun, Apr 01, 2018 at 11:53am

We’re going to Six Flags Great Adventure today on the first warm-ish day of spring. I’m excited. We’ll see how it is. I’ve never gone there before.

Sat, Mar 31, 2018 at 10:19am

My Mac came back from the stalled OS update, but I decided to nuke the hard drive and reinstall macOS anyway. Too many little things have been broken lately. It’s the first time I have done so on this machine ever. I’ve had it almost 5 years. 🤞

Fri, Mar 30, 2018 at 03:18pm

SwiftoDo 2.11.1 is now available in the App Store. It improves hardware keyboard support in the task list and task editor. Now you can type the first character to make picking priority, project, and context faster.

Fri, Mar 30, 2018 at 09:36am

Once again, a macOS point update has stalled on my old MacBook Pro. It has been stuck for nearly 8 hours. I guess I will force reboot (later) and cross my fingers that it comes back to life.

Hot take: Swift 4.1 is .1 better than Swift 4.

Thu, Mar 29, 2018 at 09:06pm

It’s a big Apple software update day today! iOS 11.3 and Xcode 9.3 finally were released. I hope the new Xcode works out more of the Swift-related kinks. Xcode 9.2 still can’t jump to many of my method definitions, and I’ve never understood why.

Thu, Mar 29, 2018 at 02:18pm

There’s nothing quite like learning new T-SQL commands. I’m learning more about window functions, such as LAST VALUE today. The reason? Messed up data that we are dealing with.

Thu, Mar 29, 2018 at 10:09am

I just signed up for the Git Tower Version 2 Public Beta. I’m not sure if I want to pay so much for a Git client (after the beta expires), when SourceTree is free, but SourceTree has been so buggy recently I am getting sick of it.

Tue, Mar 27, 2018 at 10:31pm

I am fixing more bugs in my iOS app this week. The bugs are mostly related to navigating a table view via the keyboard. It worked better under the iOS 10 SDK. It’s pretty clear that Apple cares very little about full hardware keyboard support on iOS. It can be awesome, though.

Tue, Mar 27, 2018 at 10:23pm

Presuming I trade in my iPad Air 2, the new iPad looks pretty compelling to me. I’m not sure it is worth giving up the non-glare coated, fully laminated display, however. I do feel like the Air 2 only has about one good year left in it, and 1-2 not so good years after that.

Tue, Mar 27, 2018 at 06:59pm

Do any Micro Bloggers host their own RSS feed reader back-end? I’ve been curious about Tiny Tiny RSS and other competitors over the years, but I’m not sure it is worth it.

Mon, Mar 26, 2018 at 08:57pm

🎵 Max Richter's "Sleep"

I am unreasonably excited to learn about Max Richter’s 8 1/2 hour album “Sleep”. It is meant to be played all night long, as you sleep. What I have heard so far is quiet, relaxing, and beautiful. I doubt my wife would let us play it through the night while we sleep. But maybe we could play it instead of white noise for our kids.

Sun, Mar 25, 2018 at 09:11pm

I’m not so good at Micro Monday recommendations for whatever reason, but I do try to reach out to people on the platform and provide help, kindness, support, and encouragement on a regular basis. Small kindnesses do make a difference to people, both in person and online.

Sat, Mar 24, 2018 at 10:28pm

🎭 Last night my wife and I saw “Motown: The Musical”. We enjoyed it but thought it was too sanitized and limited in viewpoint to be interesting. I would have liked to hear more (any?) complete songs. The music is fantastic, of course. We’ll be listening to those records today.

Sat, Mar 24, 2018 at 10:02am

SwiftoDo 2.11.0 is now available in the App Store. It adds a URL scheme to add task (x-callback-url), a network activity indicator, and fixes a major hanging bug.
